poem:
### Persisting Flame

In the land across the sea,  
a cold wind whispers change;  
men in towers debate,  
while the earth turns slowly.  
But the heart of the planet,  
a trembling ember, refuses  
to extinguish. Against the  
grains of time, we kindle  
our passion for a tomorrow  
that cannot be signed away.
